item.title: Managing Storage: Creating & Mounting File Systems
item.description: Partitions by themselves aren’t of any use if they don’t contain a file system. On RHEL 8 different file systems can be used, the default being xfs. To format a partition with one of the supported file systems we can use the mkfs command followed by the -t option to specify a specific file system. Alternatively, you can use a file system-specific tool like mkfs.xfs to format an xfs file system or mkfs.
